definition: philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

pinyin: ke4 guan1 wei2 xin1 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Kant and Hegel have developed idealism.
sentences.chinese: 康德和黑格爾發展了唯心主義。

sentences.english: A idealism game, only you see it is it exist.
sentences.chinese: 一個唯心主義的遊戲，只有你看到的纔是存在的。

sentences.english: There are two kinds of comprehensions—idealism and contemplative materialism—in the history.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上出現了唯心主義和直觀唯物主義兩種理解方式。

sentences.english: Magee: Obviously that means not only that you reject idealism but also that you reject dualism.
sentences.chinese: 顯而易見，你反對唯心主義，而且也反對二元論。

sentences.english: I never appreciated idealism before. Yet I can't accept it.
sentences.chinese: 以前我從沒有欣賞過唯心主義，儘管我仍然接受不了。

sentences.english: This is a heated debate which involves materialist as opposed to idealist views.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場唯物主義與唯心主義的大論戰。

sentences.english: In the following discussion, only physicalistic monisms are considered. (See also: idealism.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的唯心主義的一元論現在在西方不很常見。

sentences.english: Recognition of Philosophical Idealism from Logical Priority;
sentences.chinese: 我思故我在〔唯心主義哲學的一種說法〕。

sentences.english: In his eyes, all of these kinds of new Marxism are a kind of human-centralization as idealism.
sentences.chinese: 在他看來這些都是唯心主義的人類中心主義。

definition: the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
